paragraph.paragraph:
The second grid in the
00_introduction.xml object tool gives information about Current object and dropped objects. By default, the first object in the object view is the object corresponding to the
../30_call_stack_tool/00_introduction.xml current stack element . However, it is possible to drop any object onto the object view to manage it. Whereas the object corresponding to the current stack element may change each time the application is stopped, objects that were manually added to the object view are kept. They are only discarded when the application exits, or when the
30_remove_object_command.xml remove object command is used.

All objects can be expanded to see the
15_attribute_symbols.xml value of their attributes . They are also
../../../../../tools/eiffelstudio/reference/05_general_interface_description/10_general_interface_mechanisms/10_pick_and_drop.xml pickable , so that it is possible to drop them onto a an expression evaluator tool (alias Watch tool), or an editor to inspect the class the object belongs to. It is also possible to use the
20_slice_size_command.xml set slice size command with /libraries/base/reference/kernel/classic/special_chart.xmlSPECIAL objects or NATIVE_ARRAY objects.
paragraph.tip: Tip: You can use the ../50_expression_evaluation/index.xmlexpression evaluator tools (alias watch tools) to have the same features with even more functionalities
